intro: Coccoloba nigra, commonly known as black mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of the southeastern United States, the Caribbean, and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dark green, waxy leaves and its ability to thrive in saline and waterlogged soils. It has small, inconspicuous white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
